h2.center: Monday, April 13 at 7:30 pm School Board Meeting Live Broadcast found here

div.em: Current conditions as of 19 Apr 13:55 pm CDT

div.div: Sunny, with a high near 65. East northeast wind 10 to 15 mph.

A chance of showers and thunderstorms between 1am and 4am, then a chance of showers after 4am. Partly cloudy, with a low around 39. East northeast wind around 5 mph becoming south southwest after midnight. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts of less than a tenth of an inch, except higher amounts possible in thunderstorms.
Sunny, with a high near 68. Northwest wind 5 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph.

p.span: Here is a short video tutorial to locate our eLearning-Continuation of Learning lesson plans.

a.aria-label: Read more about Continuation of Learning

div.p: The district will be providing breakfast and lunch to those who are interested and from age 0-18. Since we are part of the summer feeding program, those rules apply to our current situation and the meals are free. We ask that you go to the link below to indicate your interest in participating so that we can get an accurate count and determine the appropriate drop off locations. The meals will begin on Monday, March 23 and end once we are back in school or on the day school is scheduled to be out for the summer. We will send out locations Friday afternoon.

a.aria-label: Read more about Breakfast and Lunch Service(COVID-19)

p.span: We want to continue to provide you with the latest information about the corona virus. We are closely monitoring reports and our staff members continue to be in contact with all necessary local and state agencies.
All updates in regards to cancellations, postponements, and all other needed information can be located on this page.
There will be no afternoon PALLS class on Wednesday, March 18th.

Superior Public Schools will be closed beginning Thursday, March 19th thru Wednesday, April 1 based upon the recommendation from State Officials. Further details on enrichment activities for students, potential meals, and other issues will be forthcoming tomorrow.

span.span: The district will be providing breakfast and lunch to those who are interested and from age 0-18. Since we are part of the summer feeding program, those rules apply to our current situation and the meals are free. We ask that you go to the link below to indicate your interest in participating so that we can get an accurate count and determine the appropriate drop off locations. The meals will begin on Monday, March 23 and end once we are back in school or on the day school is scheduled to be out for the summer. We will send out locations Friday afternoon.

p.span: There will be NO Kids Club on Wednesday, March 18th. Kids Club will be held on Tuesday, March 17th.

span.span: PALLS Preschool Open House scheduled for March 26th has been canceled. Parents that were planning to attend and have not yet gotten an application, please contact Kara Smith (402-879-1619, ksmith@superiorwildcats.org) or Mary Tietjen (402-879-5573, mtietjen@superiorwildcats.org) to get one or come to the Superior Public Schools office

Post-Prom meeting scheduled for this Thursday, 3-19-2020 is canceled at this time until further notice. Please drop off donation packets at M&R, and prizes at Superior Vision. Contact the following questions: Megan McMeen, Mmcmeen@superiorwildcats.org, or Kristin Sunday, Kristinsunday3@gmail.com
The Junior ACT Test scheduled for Tuesday, April 7th has been canceled.

p.span: 3rd Grade field trip for Tuesday, March 17 has been canceled.

Effective Monday, March 16 all NSAA activity practices are suspended until Monday, March 30 and all NSAA activity competitions are suspended until Thursday, April 2. These suspensions may be extended should the conditions warrant

span.span: The high school indoor track scheduled for Saturday, March 21 has been canceled.
The Sutton High School Track Invitational on Monday, March 23 has been canceled.
The Golf Tri with Sutton and Fillmore Central scheduled for Tuesday, March 24 has been canceled.

a.aria-label: Read more about Corona Virus Updates

div.a: This institution is an equal opportunity provider.

div.div: Superior Public Schools does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age or handicap in admission or access to or treatment or employment in, its educational programs or activities. Inquiries concerning Title VI, Title IX, and Section 504 may be referred to Marty Kobza, Superior Public Schools, Title IX Coordinator (Telephone (402)879-3257 or to the Office of Civil Rights, United States Department of Education,1961 Stout Street, Denver, Colorado, 80294
